entry.title: Open Access Selections from The Journal of Roman Studies
entry.content:
Open Access Selections from The Journal of Roman Studies (JRS) digital archive.
We are delighted to announce the completion of The Journal of Roman Studies (JRS) digital archive. JRS has published leading articles in Roman history, archaeology, literature and art for over a century. To celebrate the digitisation we are offering complimentary access to a key paper from each decade of publication.

View the entire selection below.

The Augustan Revolution Seen from the Mints of the Provinces

 
preview
Andrew Burnett
The Journal of Roman Studies / Volume101 / November 2011, pp 1 - 30 DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1017/S0075435811000104 (About DOI), Published online: 08 July 2011
  • Abstract
  • View PDF
    (631 KB)
  • View HTML
    (10.099 MB)

‘Patriots and Professors’: A Century of Roman Studies, 1910–2010

 
preview
Christopher Stray
The Journal of Roman Studies / Volume100 / November 2010, pp 1 - 31 DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1017/S0075435810000018 (About DOI), Published online: 01 June 2010

    (448 KB)
  • View HTML
    (17.392 MB)
